Atoms

Colors

Description

All colors used by the site.

Example for color swatches

Color swatches

white

Description

  • background color
  • hsla(0, 0, 100%, 1)

black

Description

  • text color
  • hsla(170, 45%, 5%, 1)

Usage

Colors do not exists alone. They are forming color pairs: a foreground color on a background color.

Colors pairs have contrast. Better the contrast better the readability and perception.

Web standards suggest high enough color contrast ratios to make websites readable for people with color vision deficiency.

Color pairs

This site uses color pairs accessible for everybody. With a contrast ratio checker we make sure all pairings pass the AAA or AA levels for any text.

Example for color pairs

Color pairs

Black on white

Description

  • Contrast: AAA

White on black

Description

  • Contrast: AAA

Source code

Code snippets

  • // All color codes
$white: hsla(0, 0, 100%, 1);
$black: hsla(170, 45%, 5%, 1);


// All color pairs
@mixin colors($scheme: black-on-white) {
   @if ($scheme == black-on-white) {
      color: $black;
      background-color: $white;
  } @if ($scheme == white-on-black) {
      color: $white;
      background-color: $black;
  }
}


// All color codes collected in a list
$colors: hsla(0, 0, 100%, 1), hsla(170, 45%, 5%, 1);


// All color pairs collected in a list
$color-pairs: black-on-white, white-on-black;

Fonts

Description

All fonts used by the site.

Example for font families

Source Sans Pro

A subtle sans serif typeface for body text

Grumpy wizards make toxic brew for the evil Queen and Jack.

One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams, he found himself transformed in his bed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armour-like back, and if he lifted his head a little he could see his brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections.

The bedding was hardly able to cover it and seemed ready to slide off any moment. His many legs, pitifully thin compared with the size of the rest of him, waved about helplessly as he looked.

Montserrat

A strong sans serif typeface for headlines and navigation

Grumpy wizards make toxic brew for the evil Queen and Jack.

One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams, he found himself transformed in his bed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armour-like back, and if he lifted his head a little he could see his brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections.

The bedding was hardly able to cover it and seemed ready to slide off any moment. His many legs, pitifully thin compared with the size of the rest of him, waved about helplessly as he looked.

Usage

A font family is rarely used raw, as is by default. It is adapted to the site's needs. For example headlines are converted to uppercase with larger letter spacing; navigation text is made smaller or heavier.

To maintain typographic consistency accross the site these transformations are recorded and reused all the time.

Example for font mixins

Font mixins

Body

Description

$body

set in font-weight: 400,

Styleguide title

Description

$styleguide-title

set in font-weight: 600, font-size: $heading-level-2,

Styleguide item title

Description

$styleguide-item-title

set in font-weight: 600, font-size: $heading-level-1,

Styleguide item subtitle

Description

$styleguide-item-subtitle

set in font-weight: 600, font-size: 100%,

Colors and fonts

Colors of this site were choosen to have maximum contrast for better viewability.

The following examples display all font and color combinations used on this site.

Source code

Code snippets

  • // Served from Google Fonts
@import url(http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Source+Sans+Pro:400,600|Montserrat:400,700|);

// Special font mixins
@mixin font($type: body) { 
  @if ($type == body) {
    font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif;
    font-weight: 400;
    
  }
  @if ($type == styleguide-title) {
    font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif;
    font-weight: 600;
    font-size: $heading-level-2;
    
  }
  @if ($type == styleguide-item-title) {
    font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif;
    font-weight: 600;
    font-size: $heading-level-1;
    
  }
  @if ($type == styleguide-item-subtitle) {
    font-family: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif;
    font-weight: 600;
    font-size: 100%;
    
  }
}


// A list of all font families
$font-families: Source Sans Pro, Montserrat;


// A list of all font mixins
$font-mixins: body, styleguide-title, styleguide-item-title, styleguide-item-subtitle;

Headings

Description

Heading levels based on Fibonacci numbers

Example

Technical description

Since Compass has no support yet for Flexbox there is a set of mixins created using SCSS Flexbox Mixins

Source code

Code snippets

  • // Heading levels
// - based on lamb.cc/typograph using Le Corbuisier ratios
// - the even sizes are Fibonacci numbers, the odd size are an in between ratio
$heading-level-1: 1.3077em;
$heading-level-2: 1.6154em;
$heading-level-3: 2.1154em;
$heading-level-4: 2.6154em;
$heading-level-5: 3.4231em;
$heading-level-6: 4.2308em;
$heading-level-7: 5.5385em;
$heading-level-8: 6.8462em;

Flexbox

Description

A flexible, responsive container.

Example

Technical description

Since Compass has no support yet for Flexbox there is a set of mixins created using SCSS Flexbox Mixins

  • Flexbox direction
  • Flexbox wrap

Source code

Code snippets

  • // A flexbox container with default settings
// - all possible settings at http://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/
// - cross browser CSS at http://the-echoplex.net/flexyboxes
// Params:
// - inline: 
//    - true: the container will take only the space defined by it's content
//    - false: the container will take the whole available space indifferenr of its content
// - $direction: row (left-to-right)
// - $wrap: nowrap (single line)
@mixin flexbox($inline: false, $direction: null, $wrap: null, $justify-content: null, $align-items: null) {
  display: -webkit-box;      /* OLD - iOS 6-, Safari 3.1-6 */
  display: -moz-box;         /* OLD - Firefox 19- (buggy but mostly works) */
  display: -ms-flexbox;      /* TWEENER - IE 10 */
  display: -webkit-flex;     /* NEW - Chrome */
  display: flex;             /* NEW, Spec - Opera 12.1, Firefox 20+ */
  
  @if ($inline != false) {
    display: -webkit-box;
    display: -moz-box;
    display: -ms-inline-flexbox;
    display: -webkit-inline-flex;
    display: inline-flex;
  } 
  
  @if ($direction) {
    @include flexbox-direction($direction);
  }
  
  @if ($wrap) {
    @include flexbox-wrap($wrap);
  }
  
  @if ($justify-content) {
    @include flexbox-justify-content($justify-content);
  }
  
  @if ($align-items) {
    @include flexbox-align-items($align-items);
  }
 }

Flex item

Description

Items of the flexible container.

Example

Technical description

Since Compass has no support yet for Flexbox there is a set of mixins created using SCSS Flexbox Mixins

  • Flex item order
  • Flex grow
  • Flex shrink
  • Flex basis
  • Flex
  • Flex align

Source code

Code snippets

  • // How items are aligned inside a flexbox
// - https://github.com/mastastealth/sass-flex-mixin/blob/master/flex.scss

@mixin flex-item($order: 0, $flex-grow: 0, $flex-shrink: 1, $flex-basis: auto, $align-self: auto) {
  @include flex-order($order);
  @include flex($flex-grow, $flex-shrink, $flex-basis);
  @include flex-align-self($align-self);
}

HTML5 Outliner

Description

All HTML5 elements must outline well. Each major grouping element section article aside nav has a title by default which is hidden on the user interface but visible for HTML5 outliner bots.

Example

Technical description

Since Compass has no support yet for Flexbox there is a set of mixins created using SCSS Flexbox Mixins

Source code

Code snippets

  • @mixin html5-outliner {
  section, article, aside, nav {
    @include hide-title;
  }
}

@mixin hide-title {
  > h3 {
    display: none;
  }
}

@mixin show-title {
  > h3 {
    display: block;
  }
}
